document.docAuthor: Williams, Daryl J. & Langor, David W.
document.masterDocTitle: Description of Mature Larvae ofPissodes yunnanensisLangor and Zhang andPissodes punctatusLangor and Zhang (Coleoptera: Curculionidae) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of Mature Larvae ofPissodes yunnanensisLangor and Zhang andPissodes punctatusLangor and Zhang (Coleoptera: Curculionidae) from China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Pissodes yunnanensis Langor and Zhang, 1999
( Figs. 1–9 , 10 , 12 )

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Pissodes yunnanensis Langor and Zhang
, in
Langor et al. 1999: 601

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Larvae of
P. yunnanensis
may be separated from those of other known
Pissodes species
by the following combination of characters: head with pale area on center of dorsal surface present only around base of des1 ( Fig. 1 ); antenna with a conspicuous, elongate sensorium, as long as wide at base or longer, with truncate apex ( Fig. 1 ); occipital foramen with ventral apodemes, curvature of foramen between apodemes discontinuous with remainder ( Fig. 4 ); most specimens with pigmentation of pronotum pale and present only as a faintly pigmented stripe near anteromedial margin to faintly pigmented on mediodorsal ¼ of sclerite, rarely absent ( Fig. 10 ); and prodorsum of abdominal segments with posterior margin medially sinuate, prodorsum arcuate ( Fig. 12 ).

caption.paragraph:
Figs. 1–4. Head capsule of the fourth instar of
Pissodes yunnanensis
. 1) Dorsal aspect (habitus anterior view); 2) Posterior aspect (habitus dorsal view); 3) Lateral aspect; 4) Ventral aspect (habitus posterior view). des1–des5 = dorsal epicranial setae; fs1–fs5 = frontal setae; les1–les2 = lateral epicranial setae; pes1–pes4 = posterior epicranial setae; ves1–ves2 = ventral epicranial setae.

Figs. 5–7. Mouthparts of the fourth instar of
Pissodes yunnanensis
. 5) Clypeus and labrum; 6) Epipharynx; 7) Labiomaxillary complex. als1–als4 = anterolateral setae; ams = anteromedian seta; cls1–cls2 = clypeal setae; dms = dorsal malar setae, lig1–lig2 = ligular setae; lms1–lms2 = labral setae; mes1–mes3 = median epipharyngeal setae; pms1–pms3 = postmental setae.

Figs. 10–11. Left half of the pronotum of the fourth instar of
Pissodes spp.
showing sclerite in dorsal view. 10)
P. yunnanensis
; 11)
P. punctatus
.

Figs. 8–9. Apex of the abdomen of the fourth instar of
Pissodes yunnanensis
. 8) Lateral view; 9) Dorsoposterior view. eps1–eps2 = epipleural setae; pds = postdorsal setae; prs = prodorsal seta.

Figs. 12–13. Abdominal segments I and II of the fourth instar of
Pissodes spp.
in dorsal view. 12)
P. yunnanensis
; 13)
P. punctatus
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material Examined.
China . Guizhou Province . Haila , 26°49′N 103°46′E ,
iv.2003
, col. Hongrui Zhang , 1 second instar, 4 third instar
.
Kunming Province . Shongming, ex.
Pinus yunnanensis
,
v.2003
, col. Hongrui Zhang , 1 second instar, 2 third instar, 3 pupae , 2 adults
.
Sichuan Province . Sichang , 27°90′N 102°25′E , ex.
Pinus yunnanensis
,
10–20. v.1993
, col. N. Jielin , 1 first instar, 10 third instar, 26 fourth instar, 26 pupae
.
Yunnan Province . Dashao , 25°26′N 102°56′E , 26.1
v.2003
, col. Hongrui Zhang , 4 third instar, 2 fourth instar, 3 pupae
;
Lashi , 26°48′N 100°04′E ,
11.iv.2004
, col. Hongrui Zhang , 3 fourth instar, 3 pupae
;
Linjiang , ex.
Pinus yunnanensis
,
v.2002
, col. Hongrui Zhang , 1 third instar, 2 fourth instar, 3 pupae , 2 adults
;
Songming County , ex.
Pinus yunnanensis
,
iv.2003
, col. D. Langor , 2 third instar, 3 fourth instar, 1 pupa
.
